reviewText: More about Israelis than India, actually, but this film seemed to give me an inside glimpse into Israeli culture and places off the beaten track, both in India and in peoples' souls.

It was nice experience to see how the parents are feelings when they hanging with shier sons and daughters in the far away villages of India. It was good also to see how they interact with the bad habits of living their: smoking drugs for example. This movie is a good example of 2 generations collide.

Like Hummus Curry This film tries to describe the young Israelis of today and their self-searching in India. I liked the connection between the travelers and their parents. The scenery is magnificent!
